publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1750# Bill Butler: International Credit Union Day—That the Parliament notes International Credit Union Day which will take place on 21 October 2004; acknowledges the financial benefits that credit unions provide for their members through low-cost loans and savings; supports the co-operative and democratic nature of credit unions in that they involve members in their running and organisation; recognises the contribution made by the growing number of credit unions throughout the country in encouraging people to save regularly; welcomes their promotion of financial security, and applauds the role credit unions have played, and continue to play, in the regeneration of communities throughout Scotland.

S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Mike Pringle*, Christine May*, Colin Fox*, Eleanor Scott*, Murray Tosh*, Mary Scanlon*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mark Ballard*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Michael Matheson*, Jackie Baillie*, Alasdair Morgan*, Chris Ballance*, Alex Neil*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Elaine Smith*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Bruce Crawford*, Helen Eadie*, Stewart Stevenson*, Des McNulty*, Scott Barrie*, Kate Maclean*, Janis Hughes*, Nora Radcliffe*, Shiona Baird*, Christine Grahame*, Johann Lamont*, Sarah Boyack*, Patrick Harvie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Margaret Jamieson*, Pauline McNeill*

S2M-1750# Bill Butler: International Credit Union Day—That the Parliament notes International Credit Union Day which will take place on 21 October 2004; acknowledges the financial benefits that credit unions provide for their members through low-cost loans and savings; supports the co-operative and democratic nature of credit unions in that they involve members in their running and organisation; recognises the contribution made by the growing number of credit unions throughout the country in encouraging people to save regularly; welcomes their promotion of financial security, and applauds the role credit unions have played, and continue to play, in the regeneration of communities throughout Scotland. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mike Pringle, Christine May, Colin Fox, Eleanor Scott, Murray Tosh, Mary Scanlon, Bristow Muldoon, Mark Ballard, Dr Elaine Murray, Michael Matheson, Jackie Baillie, Alasdair Morgan, Chris Ballance, Alex Neil, Carolyn Leckie, Mr Duncan McNeil, Elaine Smith, Ms Wendy Alexander, Bruce Crawford, Helen Eadie, Stewart Stevenson, Des McNulty, Scott Barrie, Kate Maclean, Janis Hughes, Nora Radcliffe, Shiona Baird, Christine Grahame, Johann Lamont, Sarah Boyack, Patrick Harvie, Marilyn Livingstone, Margaret Jamieson, Pauline McNeill, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Maureen Macmillan*, Frances Curran*, Margo MacDonald*, John Swinburne*
S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Robin Harper*, Brian Adam*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Ms Sandra White*, Tricia Marwick*, Donald Gorrie*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Cathie Craigie*, Dr Jean Turner*, Trish Godman*, Irene Oldfather*
S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Marlyn Glen*, Mike Watson*, Karen Gillon*
S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Susan Deacon*
S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Karen Whitefield*
S2M-1750# International Credit Union Day (lodged on 22 September 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*
